Sentencas: Planar metal-supported cell designs provide cost-effective scaling-up of solid oxide fuel cells and electrolysers.
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells

Sentencas: Here, we report on the fabrication of a BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-delta-NiO (BZY15-NiO) composite electrode and BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-delta (BZY15) proton-conducting electrolyte films on metal and ceramic substrates using pulsed laser deposition (PLD).
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells

Sentencas: The results demonstrate successful sequential deposition of porous electrode and dense electrolyte structure by PLD at moderate temperatures, without the need for subsequent high-temperature sintering.
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells

Sentencas: The decrease in roughness of the metal substrate used for deposition by spray-coating intermediary oxide layers had significant importance to the fabrication of functional layers as thin films.
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells

Sentencas: Crystalline porous BZY15-NiO and dense BZY15 films were sequentially deposited at high substrate temperature on metal supports (MS) with or without an electron-conducting barrier oxide layer, e.g. MS/(BZY15-Ni)/(BZY15-NiO)/BZY15 and MS/CeO2/(BZY15-NiO)/BZY15.
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells

Sentencas: The different microstructures for electrode and electrolyte were achieved with deposition steps at different substrate temperatures (800, 600 degrees C) and a gradual decrease in the pressure of O-2 in the deposition chamber.
Titulo: Layered microstructures based on BaZr0.85Y0.15O3-δ by pulsed laser deposition for metal-supported proton ceramic electrolyser cells
